attributes.action: Changes to the law when buying and selling a property in England, Wales and NI
attributes.additional_details:
This is already a law that’s in place in Scotland, the same law should be in England, Wales and NI 

A few examples are:-

Another person guzumps an offer, the seller accepts and causes financial loss to the first buyer 

Another where a buyer at the start of the chain decides a week before completion to pull out, again causing financial loss not only to all parties in the chain but to the solicitors and estate agents for their time.
attributes.background: In England, Wales and NI there is no law in place or written negotiation between both solicitors - a purchaser and buyer when an offer is made on a property. The ‘missive’ or contract as it’s known in Scotland would prevent financial loss to gazumping, gazundering and pulling out of a property sale.
